text: they are Rosie and Jenny they were known
as the dolly sisters two hungarian
sisters who came to Paris to London to
New York and a very glittering career
throughout the 20s this is an actress
called Bessie love she was doing a photo
shoot than she was warming herself by
the studio fire how she was changing
flowers these are photographs by the
photographer James Abbe a half American
half French who had a great career in
Paris he photographed lots of stars in
London and these photographs are from
fashion shoots that he did in the 20s
all the greats love and Pat to you a
photograph but if you think of how women
were dressing was just a generation
before 20 years before and here they are
in loose clothing very beautiful you can
see their shape of their bodies this is
a complete revolution it's a revolution
and I think fashion was on the move
before of World War one but it really
took that a shock I think for the next
generation to completely throw off the
chains and really it's modern dressing
starts in the 1920s wife would have been
tough in certain levels but I think
coming out of the war you really get a
sense that it was a real change of the
status quo the fact that you know you go
from corsets to
no dependents flatten your pasts that
kind of chef that really must have been
quite liberating you know you could
actually move you could walk and dance
they dance the whole time there was a
real sense of freedom of liberation in
the 20s fashions
